attributes.action: consider income tax relief against the cost of travel to work for commuters using public transport.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
In light of recent events surrounding “acceptable expenses” being claimed by our Government, would the Prime Minister consider granting tax relief for commuters that use public transport on a daily basis?  This could potentially boost the use of public transport, and would also increase net income, thus giving more money to spend in the economy.

My thought is that currently I pay £2900 per year to travel to work, and pay this to a company that you would also be charging Corporation Tax to.  By allowing my £2900 to be deducted from my gross salary before tax, I estimate I would receive approx £100 per month more than I receive now.  If I consider this on the millions of commuters that travel into large cities each day, this would create quite a large sum of money that would be then spent in shops etc, boosting the flagging economy.
